avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a moderate southwesterly wind, further wind slabs will form. Even single winter sport participants can release avalanches easily, including medium-sized ones. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In areas bordering France, especially at high altitudes, avalanches can be large.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last two days. Since Thursday on steep slopes several small and medium-sized avalanches were observed. Several avalanches caused by skiers, of medium and in one case large size, were reported.
The sometimes strong wind has transported a lot of snow. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Distinct weak layers exist in the bottom section of the old snowpack in all aspects.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The mostly small wind slabs represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a moderate southwesterly wind, further wind slabs will form. They represent the main danger. Even single winter sport participants can release avalanches in some places. These avalanche prone locations are to be found at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example. Additionally in some places avalanches can be released in deep layers reach medium size.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 20 cm of snow fell in the last few days. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: A little new snow above approximately 900 m.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. The more recent wind slabs are small and in some cases prone to triggering.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last few days as well as local wind slabs are lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.
Wind slabs can in some places be released by people. This applies especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, especially in pass areas in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, especially on very steep slopes.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Thursday. The southwesterly wind has transported the new snow, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable).
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: Some new snow above approximately 900 m.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER
